result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen H. Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephen H. Bailey is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephen H. Bailey was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>40g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Alcohol / drug; Criminal thinking. 
++  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  ++ Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 11 years WSP:  5 years initial confinement w/credit for 47 days served; 6 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Krejcarek.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski requests to adjourn SEH to allow deft time to talk to his family.  SEH is adjourned to 3/2/17 at 11:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski requests adjournment, has not had the opportunity to review the PSI with the deft which he needs to obtain a copy of.  SEH adjourned to 2/22/17 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
***BOND REVOKED***

131pm  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney James Fields-Bowers.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 17, 2017 at 10:00 am in Br.6.  Bond revoked.  kmk

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case set for jury selection.  Atty Bielski is in trial in another branch.  DDA Graveley states the deft has new charges in Milwaukee and has since had a violation; requests to modify bond.  Atty Bielski states that prior to appearing today the deft informed him that he wanted him to withdraw and have new counsel appointed.  Court amends bond to $5,000 cash bond w/same conditions previously set *Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/Patrick S Sr and Patrick S Jr.  Deft states he wants to keep Atty Bielski as counsel.  JSH set for 3/10/16 at 8:30am, JS set for 5/9/16 at 8:30am.  Deft taken into custody from court.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA M Graveley.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states hs is unsure if the swab sample from the deft after the last hearing was sent to the crime lab.  Court instructs that the sample is to be taken (if not still available or if not sent to the crime lab) and sent to the crime lab today.  Case remains set for trial.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  DDA Graveley states he will be sending firearm and drugs to crime lab for testing.  JSH 12/18/15 at 11am and JS 2/8/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Exhibits D1, D3 and D4 inventoried and stored in Br 1 exhibit room on 4/8/16.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Suppression motion.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Deputy John Lanctot.  Court denies motion to suppress for reasons set forth on the record.  FPT 10/15/15 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by phone w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski states was going to prepare a brief but after reviewing file he does not believe a complete evidentiary record was made; believes testimony needs to be taken.  MH continued to 9/29/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Atty D Bielski appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski states the deft is in the hospital having surgery on this date.  DDA Graveley states there has been a decision in the Houghton case by the US Supreme Court.  Atty Bielski states he would like a decision on motion brought in this case; would like time to sumit a letter brief.  Court to review Houghton decision.  Decision on motion set for 9/11/15 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.

With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Atty Bielski the STC of 6/11/15 at 2:30pm is rescheduled; as they are waiting for the WI Supreme Court to make a decision in the State v. Houghton case which should be out by mid-July; reset to 8/20/15 at 9am.

With Atty Bielski and Elizabeth/ADA Graveley the STC of 4/9/15 at 9am is rescheduled; as the Wisconsin case they are waiting on, Houghton, interpreting the SCOTUS decision in Heien, is being argued on April 22; STC is reset to 6/11/15 at 2:30pm.
With Atty Bielski and ADA Graveley the STC of 2/6/15 at 10am is rescheduled, as they are still waiting on the Supreme Court deciison; reset to 4/9/15 at 9am.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Bielski's motion to suppress; states there has been a petition for a court of appeals review and the US Supreme Court case decision is pending which could affect the Houghton decision; requests to set this case over until the decision is in.  ADA Graveley agrees.  STC set for 2/6/15 at 10am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
